title: Frigate
description: Developing Sepulsa.com Mobile Web Application using React JS. The aim of the project is to replace the traditional mobile web to a faster, more responsive, mobile application alike - web site. Visit m.sepulsa.com to see the project.

title: Integrated Porn Autocensor
description: Porn content censoring system based on browser extension using Logistic Regression for image classification and TF.IDF for text classification

title: Huginn & Muninn
description: IOS and Android application for sepulsa.com. Built using Objective-C and Native Java

title: IsTrumpStillF*ingPresident?
description: Answers the question. Attempts to provide some joy.

title: blerDCon
description: BlerDCon will be the first nerd convention to ever be truly universal. Weâ€™re structured to cater to minority nerds in all genres. To ensure that the inclusive experience we offer has something for you.

title: Detik-PageRank
description: Implemented and designed data lake for further pipelined to many application. Developed application to counting real time page view articles for determine trending and most popular articles.

title: Muninn
description: Android payment app built using Java

title: FancyCard
description: Various demos of my personal website (thalida.com) developed in various frameworks and methods. A new demo will be added as the front-end development landscape changes, and will showcase the new techniques that have become part of the modern standard.

title: SchedStalk
description: Natural Language question answering using Named Entity Recognition and Levenstein Distance to ease student discover their schedules and classes

title: SemanticNET
description: Ontology based query expansion search engine to discover gene information and taxonomy hierarchy using Pseudo Relevance Feedback and RNN

title: Live-ish Scene
longDescription: The Live-ish Scene on the left automatically updates throughout the day. This project was a very fun experiment for myself, and is something that I find myself coming back to and making little tweaks and improvements on every few months.

Basically, everything is dynamic and changes based on time, weather, number of visits, if mercury is in retrograde. Well, not the last part. But, you get the idea. Stuff moves. Text Changes. Cool stuff. Oh, and I made the graphics.

title: Space Scene
longDescription: This site was created for the #newwwyear challange. I knew I wanted to recreate it in vue, with a new theme.
After a few back and forth interations, I came up with this. You can check out my old site to compare the two.
The main content of my site didn't change much in style or content. The largest set of updates, outside of the under the hood change from angular to vue, were the updates to the space scene.
This Space Scene similar to the one on the previous iteration of this site, uses the current time, weather, and how often you've visited to create a scene that's unique for you.
